content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>VCGI, ANR, and Massachusetts Technology Collaborative</origin> <pubdate>20081021</pubdate> <pubtime>unknown</pubtime> <title>ClimateOther_WINDSPD70M</title> <edition>2008A</edition> <geoform>raster digital data</geoform> <serinfo> <sername>Predicted wind speed at 70 m height</sername> <issue>2008A</issue> </serinfo> <pubinfo> <pubplace>Waterbury VT 05676</pubplace> <publish>VT Center for Geographic Information</publish> </pubinfo> <othercit>Tile Structure - STATE</othercit> <onlink>http://www.vcgi.org/dataware/default.cfm?layer=ClimateOther_WINDSPD70M</onlink> <onlink>http://www.vcgi.org/dataware/default.cfm?layer=ClimateOther_WINDSPD70M&mapit=yes</onlink> <onlink>http://maps.vcgi.org:8080/wmsconnector/com.esri.wms.Esrimap?servicename=DATAWARE_VCGI&VERSION=1.1.1&request=getmap&BBOX=-73.45416,42.72279,-71.46528,45.018356&SRS=EPSG:4326&LAYERS=CLIMATEOTHER_WINDSPD70M&WIDTH=300&HEIGHT=400&FORMAT=image/gif</onlink> <lworkcit> <citeinfo> <origin>Massachusetts Technology Collaborative</origin> <pubdate>20030602</pubdate> <title>New England Wind Energy Resource Maps</title> <edition>version 1.0</edition> <geoform>multimedia presentation</geoform> <othercit>The Massachusetts Technology Collaborative, in conjunction with the Connecticut Clean Energy Fund and Northeast Utilities, commissioned and funded the preparation of Wind Energy Resource Maps for New England. Maps were developed by TrueWind Solutions, LLC and AWS Scientific, Inc.</othercit> <onlink>http://www.mtpc.org/rebates/Community_Wind/wind_maps.htm</onlink> </citeinfo> </lworkcit> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>Wind speed predictions at 70m are generated by a numerical model that simulates weather conditions over a 15-year period, taking into account geophysical inputs such as elevation, land use, and vegetation. The information was produced by TrueWind Solutions using their Mesomap system. This work was commissioned by the Massachusetts Technology Collaborative, in conjunction with the Connecticut Clean Energy Fund and Northeast Utilities, and the results have been validated by NREL (National Renewable Energy Laboratory).</abstract> <purpose>General planning of wind power development.</purpose> <supplinf> Data is not suitable for micro-siting potential development projects. The raster dataset has a 200m x 200m cell size and  raster resolution near 1:725K scale.  The VT portion has been extracted from the original datset and reprojected into VT State Plane, NAD83, and Meters.  The original dataset covered ME, NH, VT, MA, CT, and RI in UTM Zone 19, WGS 84, and Meters.  Seventy meters is a typical tower height for the current generation of large wind turbines of 750 KW to 2 MW rated capacity, though towers may be taller.  Generally speaking, commercial wind power projects require a resource with a mean speed of at least 7 m/s (TrueWind Solutions, Northern New England Project Report, 2003). </supplinf> </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>20030602</caldate> </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>publication date</current> </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress> <update>None planned</update> </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-74.406898</westbc> <eastbc>-66.027709</eastbc> <northbc>47.744885</northbc> <southbc>40.751820</southbc> </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>ISO 19115 Topic Category</themekt> <themekey>climatologyMeteorologyAtmosphere</themekey> <themekey>utilitiesCommunication</themekey> </theme> <theme> <themekt>none</themekt> <themekey>Wind Speed</themekey> <themekey>Wind Power</themekey> <themekey>Renewable Energy</themekey> </theme> <place> <placekt>GNIS</placekt> <placekey>Vermont</placekey> <placekey>New England</placekey> <placekey>Northeast</placekey> <placekey>United States</placekey> </place> </keywords> <accconst>VCGI, ANR, and and the State of Vermont make no representations of any kind including, but not limited to the warranties of merchantability or fitness for a particular use, nor are any such warranties to be implied with respect to the data.</accconst> <useconst> Although every effort has been made to ensure the accuracy of information, errors may be reflected in data supplied. The user must be aware of data conditions and bear responsibility for the appropriate use of the information with respect to possible errors, orginal map scale, collection methodology, currency of data, and other condition.  Secondary distribution must be accompanied by this documentation.  Users of the information are requested to acknowledge the roles of TrueWind Solutions, LLC and the three funding organizations;  Connecticut Clean Energy Fund, the Massachusetts Technology Collaborative, and Northeast Utilities System. </useconst> <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntorgp> <cntorg>VT Center for Geographic Information</cntorg> </cntorgp> <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing and Physical Address</addrtype> <address>58 South Main Street, Suite 2</address> <city>Waterbury</city> <state>VT</state> <postal>05676</postal> <country>USA</country> </cntaddr> <cntvoice>802/882-3000</cntvoice> <cnttdd>None</cnttdd> <cntfax>802/882-3001</cntfax> <cntemail>info@vcgi.org</cntemail> <hours>9am - 5pm, M-F</hours> </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <browse> <browsen>http://maps.vcgi.org:8080/wmsconnector/com.esri.wms.Esrimap?servicename=DATAWARE_VCGI&VERSION=1.1.1&request=getmap&BBOX=-73.45416,42.72279,-71.46528,45.018356&SRS=EPSG:4326&LAYERS=CLIMATEOTHER_WINDSPD70M&WIDTH=300&HEIGHT=400&FORMAT=image/gif</browsen> <browsed>GIF</browsed> <browset>GIF</browset> </browse> <secinfo> <secsys>N/A</secsys> <secclass>Unclassified</secclass> <sechandl>No Security Considerations</sechandl> </secinfo> <native>Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.2.1350</native> </idinfo> <dataqual> <attracc> <attraccr>Not assessed.</attraccr> </attracc> <logic>Not assessed.</logic> <posacc> <horizpa> <horizpar>Not assessed.
